metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Animations
CSS Animations
CSS allows animation of HTML elements without using JavaScript!
content.html: CSS allows animation of HTML elements without using JavaScript!

content.text: In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:
content.html: In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:

content.text: What are CSS Animations?
An animation lets an element gradually change from one style to another.
content.html: An animation lets an element gradually change from one style to another.

content.text: You can change as many CSS properties you want, as many times as you want.
content.html: You can change as many CSS properties you want, as many times as you want.

content.text: To use CSS animation, you must first specify some keyframes for the animation.
content.html: To use CSS animation, you must first specify some keyframes for the animation.

content.text: Keyframes hold what styles the element will have at certain times.
content.html: Keyframes hold what styles the element will have at certain times.

content.text: The @keyframes Rule
When you specify CSS styles inside the @keyframes rule, the animation will gradually change from the current style to the new style at certain times.
content.html: When you specify CSS styles inside the @keyframes rule, the animation will gradually change from the current style to the new style at certain times.

content.text: To get an animation to work, you must bind the animation to an element.
content.html: To get an animation to work, you must bind the animation to an element.

content.text: The following example binds the "example" animation to the <div> element. The animation will last for 4 seconds, and it will gradually change the background-color of the <div> element from "red" to "yellow":
content.html: The following example binds the "example" animation to the <div> element. The animation will last for 4 seconds, and it will gradually change the background-color of the <div> element from "red" to "yellow":

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

content.code_html:
/* The animation code */
@keyframes example {
  from {background-color: red;}
  to {background-color: yellow;}
}

/* The element to apply the animation to */
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

content.text: Note: The animation-duration property defines how long an animation should take to complete. If the animation-duration property is not specified, no animation will occur, because the default value is 0s (0 seconds).
content.html: Note: The animation-duration property defines how long an animation should take to complete. If the animation-duration property is not specified, no animation will occur, because the default value is 0s (0 seconds).

content.text: In the example above we have specified when the style will change by using the keywords "from" and "to" (which represents 0% (start) and 100% (complete)).
content.html: In the example above we have specified when the style will change by using the keywords "from" and "to" (which represents 0% (start) and 100% (complete)).

content.text: It is also possible to use percent. By using percent, you can add as many style changes as you like.
content.html: It is also possible to use percent. By using percent, you can add as many style changes as you like.

content.text: The following example will change the background-color of the <div> element when the animation is 25% complete, 50% complete, and again when the animation is 100% complete:
content.html: The following example will change the background-color of the <div> element when the animation is 25% complete, 50% complete, and again when the animation is 100% complete:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

syntax_highlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

content.code_html:
/* The animation code */
@keyframes example {
  0%   {background-color: red;}
  25%  {background-color: yellow;}
  50%  {background-color: blue;}
  100% {background-color: green;}
}

/* The element to apply the animation to */
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

content.text: The following example will change both the background-color and the position of the <div> element when the animation is 25% complete, 50% complete, and again when the animation is 100% complete:
content.html: The following example will change both the background-color and the position of the <div> element when the animation is 25% complete, 50% complete, and again when the animation is 100% complete:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

syntax_highlighting.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

content.code_html:
/* The animation code */
@keyframes example {
  0%   {background-color:red; left:0px; top:0px;}
  25%  {background-color:yellow; left:200px; top:0px;}
  50%  {background-color:blue; left:200px; top:200px;}
  75%  {background-color:green; left:0px; top:200px;}
  100% {background-color:red; left:0px; top:0px;}
}

/* The element to apply the animation to */
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* The element to apply the animation to */

width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;

content.text: Delay an Animation
The animation-delay property specifies a delay for the start of an animation.
content.html: The animation-delay property specifies a delay for the start of an animation.

content.text: The following example has a 2 seconds delay before starting the animation:
content.html: The following example has a 2 seconds delay before starting the animation:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-delay: 2s;
}

content.text: Negative values are also allowed. If using negative values, the animation will start as if it had already been playing for N seconds.
content.html: Negative values are also allowed. If using negative values, the animation will start as if it had already been playing for N seconds.

content.text: In the following example, the animation will start as if it had already been playing for 2 seconds:
content.html: In the following example, the animation will start as if it had already been playing for 2 seconds:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-delay: -2s;
}

content.text: Set How Many Times an Animation Should Run
The animation-iteration-count property specifies the number of times an animation should run.
content.html: The animation-iteration-count property specifies the number of times an animation should run.

content.text: The following example will run the animation 3 times before it stops:
content.html: The following example will run the animation 3 times before it stops:

syntaxHighlighting.text: div {  width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;}
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;

content.code: div {  width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;}

syntax_highlighting.text: div {  width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;}
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-iteration-count: 3;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: div {  width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;}
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  position: relative;  background-color: red;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 4s;  animation-iteration-count: 3;

content.text: The following example uses the value "infinite" to make the animation continue for ever:
content.html: The following example uses the value "infinite" to make the animation continue for ever:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-iteration-count: infinite;
}

content.text: Run Animation in Reverse Direction or Alternate Cycles
The animation-direction property specifies whether an animation should be played forwards, backwards or in alternate cycles.
content.html: The animation-direction property specifies whether an animation should be played forwards, backwards or in alternate cycles.

content.text: The animation-direction property can have the following values:
content.html: The animation-direction property can have the following values:

content.text: The following example will run the animation in reverse direction (backwards):
content.html: The following example will run the animation in reverse direction (backwards):

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-direction: reverse;
}

content.text: The following example uses the value "alternate" to make the animation run forwards first, then backwards:
content.html: The following example uses the value "alternate" to make the animation run forwards first, then backwards:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-iteration-count: 2;
  animation-direction: alternate;
}

content.text: The following example uses the value "alternate-reverse" to make the animation run backwards first, then forwards:
content.html: The following example uses the value "alternate-reverse" to make the animation run backwards first, then forwards:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  position: relative;
  background-color: red;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-iteration-count: 2;
  animation-direction: alternate-reverse;
}

content.text: Specify the Speed Curve of the Animation
The animation-timing-function property specifies the speed curve of the animation.
content.html: The animation-timing-function property specifies the speed curve of the animation.

content.text: The animation-timing-function property can have the following values:
content.html: The animation-timing-function property can have the following values:

content.text: The following example shows some of the different speed curves that can be used:
content.html: The following example shows some of the different speed curves that can be used:

content.code_html:
#div1 {animation-timing-function: linear;}
#div2 {animation-timing-function: ease;}
#div3 {animation-timing-function: ease-in;}
#div4 {animation-timing-function: ease-out;}
#div5 {animation-timing-function: ease-in-out;}

content.text: Specify the fill-mode For an Animation
CSS animations do not affect an element before the first keyframe is played or after the last keyframe is played. The animation-fill-mode property can override this behavior.
content.html: CSS animations do not affect an element before the first keyframe is played or after the last keyframe is played. The animation-fill-mode property can override this behavior.

content.text: The animation-fill-mode property specifies a style for the target element when the animation is not playing (before it starts, after it ends, or both).
content.html: The animation-fill-mode property specifies a style for the target element when the animation is not playing (before it starts, after it ends, or both).

content.text: The animation-fill-mode property can have the following values:
content.html: The animation-fill-mode property can have the following values:

content.text: The following example lets the <div> element retain the style values from the last keyframe when the animation ends:
content.html: The following example lets the <div> element retain the style values from the last keyframe when the animation ends:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background: red;  position: relative;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 3s;
    animation-fill-mode: forwards;

syntax_highlighting.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background: red;  position: relative;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 3s;
    animation-fill-mode: forwards;

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background: red;
  position: relative;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 3s;
  animation-fill-mode: forwards;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  background: red;  position: relative;  animation-name: example;  animation-duration: 3s;
    animation-fill-mode: forwards;

content.text: The following example lets the <div> element get the style values set by the first keyframe before the animation starts (during the animation-delay period):
content.html: The following example lets the <div> element get the style values set by the first keyframe before the animation starts (during the animation-delay period):

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background: red;
  position: relative;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 3s;
  animation-delay: 2s;
  animation-fill-mode: backwards;
}

content.text: The following example lets the <div> element get the style values set by the first keyframe before the animation starts, and retain the style values from the last keyframe when the animation ends:
content.html: The following example lets the <div> element get the style values set by the first keyframe before the animation starts, and retain the style values from the last keyframe when the animation ends:

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background: red;
  position: relative;
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 3s;
  animation-delay: 2s;
  animation-fill-mode: both;
}

content.text: Animation Shorthand Property
The example below uses six of the animation properties:
content.html: The example below uses six of the animation properties:

content.code_html:
div {
  animation-name: example;
  animation-duration: 5s;
  animation-timing-function: linear;
  animation-delay: 2s;
  animation-iteration-count: infinite;
  animation-direction: alternate;
}

content.text: The same animation effect as above can be achieved by using the shorthand animation property:
content.html: The same animation effect as above can be achieved by using the shorthand animation property:

content.code_html:
div {
  animation: example 5s linear 2s infinite alternate;
}

content.text: CSS Animation Properties
The following table lists the @keyframes rule and all the CSS animation properties:
content.html: The following table lists the @keyframes rule and all the CSS animation properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
@keyframes Specifies the animation code
animation A shorthand property for setting all the animation properties
animation-delay Specifies a delay for the start of an animation
animation-direction Specifies whether an animation should be played forwards, backwards or in alternate cycles
animation-duration Specifies how long time an animation should take to complete one cycle
animation-fill-mode Specifies a style for the element when the animation is not playing (before it starts, after it ends, or both)
animation-iteration-count Specifies the number of times an animation should be played
animation-name Specifies the name of the @keyframes animation
animation-play-state Specifies whether the animation is running or paused
animation-timing-function Specifies the speed curve of the animation
